title: MP defends Cornish devolution deal - with a quote from Superman
text:
By Western Morning News | Posted: October 14, 2015 By Kate Langston MP defends Cornish devolution deal - with a quote from Superman X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Comments (0) 
A Cornish MP has defended the county’s devolution deal complete with a quote from Superman, amid scepticism about the Government’s supposed requirement for elected mayors. 
North Cornwall MP Scott Mann described the Government’s offer to the region as a “historic” step, which placed power “square in the Duchy”. 
He contrasted this with the Labour government’s focus on “centralisation” through “unelected regional assemblies”, pledging that “devolution will not stop” with Cornwall. 
His comments came as MPs debated the Government’s Cities and Local Government Devolution Bill, which makes provisions for the decentralisation of powers from Whitehall. Related content West will not get 'proper deal' while Tories have power to 'rip up' promises 
The Bill has faced fierce criticism from opponents, particularly due to the requirement for local authorities to introduce a directly elected mayor in order to benefit from “full” devolution. This includes the power to increase local business rates, announced by the chancellor at the party conference. 
The Bill was amended in the House of Lords to remove this condition, but members were warned this could scupper the legislation when it goes before the Commons. And Labour MPs were unconvinced by the extent of powers being granted to local authorities by the Bill, saying it “does not offer meaningful devolution”. 
Challenging these views, Mr Mann pointed to Cornwall’s own “historic devolution deal” as proof of the Bill’s potential. 
“For years we have had nationalists in Cornwall calling for a Cornish Assembly, blaming central Government for mismanagement and complaining about decisions being taken in London,” he said. 
“I am proud to say that within weeks of securing a blue Cornwall and a Conservative majority Government we put together the largest devolution package Cornwall has ever seen. 
“I welcome every local authority in the UK having the same powers that Cornwall has had.” 
“There have long been calls in Cornwall to pull up the hypothetical draw bridge over the Tamar and cut us off from Plymouth and the rest of Britain,” he added. “But we’re doing ourselves a disservice... if we continue to naval gaze. 
“As Superman’s father once said on Krypton ‘with great power comes great responsibility’. The Cornwall deal asks leaders to deliver. 
“I say to the leaders of Cornwall Council, the local enterprise partnership and Cornwall’s clinical commissioning group: now is your time. Show us your skill, show us you can deliver for Cornwall and I give you my word devolution will not stop here.”
